title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 355.8 - Benefits "at least as favorable"
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 355.8 - Benefits "at least as favorable"
State Regulations

Benefits under a plan shall provide for each employee, or
for each employee of the class or classes of employees included under the plan, either (a) cash disability and family leave benefits, or (b) cash disability
benefits plus other benefits directly related to disability, including, without
limitation, benefits to reimburse or provide for hospital, medical and surgical
care. In either case, the cash disability and family leave benefits, exclusive
of any other benefits that may be provided under the plan, shall meet the
requirements of section
358-3.1
in order to be deemed "at
least as favorable" as the disability benefits and family leave under section
204
of the Workers' Compensation Law. This section shall take effect July 1, 1989. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
355.8

New

York State Register July 19, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 29, eff. 7/19/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
